required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will test if upfront dosing of Ranolazine can reduce myocardial biomarker release (CK-MB, Troponin) post percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI).

detailed_description.textblock:
Ranolazine has been demonstrated to decrease angina, ischemia on perfusion imaging, improve diastolic function, and cardiac metabolism. Furthermore it has been associated with reduced cardiac arrhythmias, including non-sustained ventricular tachycardia and atrial fibrillation. It has not been studied as an acute cardioprotective agent in percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI).
We hypothesize that upfront administration of Ranolazine could decrease the myocardial injury associated with PCI due to all the factors listed above (i.e. precondition the myocardium). We plan to screen all patients scheduled for an elective coronary angiogram. Those who meet criteria and consent will be randomized to either receive Ranolazine or placebo twice a day for 3 days leading up to the PCI.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Sponsor terminated study due to lack of enrollment

primary_outcome.description: Troponin labs will be drawn 8-10 hrs after PCI or at discharge whichever comes first
CK-MB labs will be drawn 8-10 hrs after PCI or at discharge whichever comes first

secondary_outcome.time_frame: TIMI Flow Rate (Grade) is assessed immediately after an interventional reperfusion attempt during a PCI (Percutaneous Coronary Intervention) procedure.
secondary_outcome.description: This TIMI classification was developed by the TIMI (Thrombolysis In Myocardial Infarction) study group to semiquantitatively assess coronary artery perfusion beyond point of occlusion on coronary angiography.* TIMI Grade [Description] TIMI 0 - no perfusion [no antegrade flow beyond the point of occlusion] TIMI 1 - penetration without perfusion [faint antegrade coronary flow beyond the occlusion with incomplete filling of the distal coronary bed] TIMI 2 - partial perfusion [delayed or sluggish antegrade flow with complete filling of the distal territory] TIMI 3 - complete perfusion [normal flow with complete filling of the distal territory] *(see http://radclass.mudr.org/content/timi-grade-flow-grading-coronary-blood-flow-during-coronary-angiography) TIMI 0 is the least favorable grade. TIMI 3 is the most favorable grade.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Atrial Fibrillation, Ventricular Tachycardia, or Ventricular Fibrillation in Coronary Cath Lab
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the PCI (Percutaneous Coronary Intervention) procedure - starting at timepoint of guidewire insertion into the access artery until removal of guidewire

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Non-sustained Ventricular Tachycardia or Atrial Fibrillation Post PCI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Following completion of PCI through hospital discharge
During the PCI (Percutaneous Coronary Intervention) procedure - starting at timepoint of guidewire insertion into the access artery until removal of guidewire

secondary_outcome.measure: Death, Myocardial Infarction (Biomarker Greater Than 2x Normal), CHF, Cardiac Arrest
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At discharge or within 1 days, whichever comes first
At discharge or within 1 days, whichever comes first
secondary_outcome.description: For the purposes of this study, a successful PCI is considered one where no additional coronary interventions were required within 24 hours after the initial PCI.

arm_group.description: Oral treatment Intervention: Drug: Ranolazine 1000 mg

intervention.description: Drug: Ranolazine 1000 mg Oral dose twice per day for 3 days leading up to PCI
Drug: Placebo Oral dose twice per day for 3 days leading up to PCI

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18 or older
- Patients undergoing Coronary Angiography with possible PCI
- Able and willing to give consent
- Able to read and write English
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current EKG or Biomarker of Acute Myocardial Infarction (MI) or Acute Coronary Syndromes (ACS)
- History of Allergy to Ranolazine
- Pregnant or Nursing
- Currently taking Ranolazine

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director, Cardiovascular Fellowship Training Program and Director, Cardiac Noninvasive Laboratory

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Troponin
outcome.description: Troponin labs will be drawn 8-10 hrs after PCI or at discharge whichever comes first
outcome.population: Of the 4 Ranolazine Group subjects, 1 was withdrawn for pre-procedure study drug non-compliance; 3 had no PCI intervention. Of the 2 Placebo Group subject, 1 had no PCI intervention. The only subject undergoing PCI intervention was from the Placebo Group and was thus the only subject undergoing this protocol required test.

outcome.title: CK-MB
outcome.description: CK-MB labs will be drawn 8-10 hrs after PCI or at discharge whichever comes first
outcome.population: For the single subject completing the PCI intervention, CK-MB was not done because the CK level was below the threshold running the CK-MB test.

outcome.title: TIMI Flow Rate (Grade)
outcome.description: This TIMI classification was developed by the TIMI (Thrombolysis In Myocardial Infarction) study group to semiquantitatively assess coronary artery perfusion beyond point of occlusion on coronary angiography.* TIMI Grade [Description] TIMI 0 - no perfusion [no antegrade flow beyond the point of occlusion] TIMI 1 - penetration without perfusion [faint antegrade coronary flow beyond the occlusion with incomplete filling of the distal coronary bed] TIMI 2 - partial perfusion [delayed or sluggish antegrade flow with complete filling of the distal territory] TIMI 3 - complete perfusion [normal flow with complete filling of the distal territory] *(see http://radclass.mudr.org/content/timi-grade-flow-grading-coronary-blood-flow-during-coronary-angiography) TIMI 0 is the least favorable grade. TIMI 3 is the most favorable grade.
outcome.time_frame: TIMI Flow Rate (Grade) is assessed immediately after an interventional reperfusion attempt during a PCI (Percutaneous Coronary Intervention) procedure.
outcome.population: The only subject undergoing PCI intervention was from the Placebo Group and was thus the only subject for whom this protocol required data point was collected.

TIMI 3 is the most favorable grade.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data was collected from time of consent through end of study discharge from hospital. Adverse events unresolved at discharge were to be followed to resolution. No events occuring after discharge were to be recorded as adverse events.
reported_events.desc: Study timeline consisted of consent, pre-procedure medication (3 days), arrival for out-patient heart cath procedure, possible PCI, post-procedure recovery time, and discharge from hospital recovery room. Time from consent to start of study meds varied. Time from start of study drug to discharge was 4 days.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
